results.title: Medieval society: the villagers
results.brief_description: Depicts a typical village of 1128 A.D. in England. Various villagers such as a bailiff, serf, reeve, miller, carpenter, swineherd, priest, shepherd and potter briefly explain their lives. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Medieval society
results.creator_credit: Gateway Film Productions and W. Hugh Baddeley
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of 14th century life in England by showing the work and responsibilities of a range of medieval people. Discusses the roles of the King, the church, the barons and the tenants.

results.title: Medieval myths and medicine
results.brief_description: Explores some of the beautifully illustrated books in an ancient European library to give an insight into the mixture of fantasy and fact, particularly in relation to medicine, that passed for learning from the fifteenth century to more recent times.
results.description: Explores some of the beautifully illustrated books in an ancient European library to give an insight into the mixture of fantasy and fact, particularly in relation to medicine, that passed for learning from the fifteenth century to more recent times.

results.title: Medieval manor (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Oscar Sams and Sidney Painter
results.brief_description: Explains the origin of the feudal system and the benefits which it offered to both lord and serf. Recreates phases of life on a representative manor, and discusses the duties of the lord and his seneschal. The work of artisans, the importance of the three field system of agriculture, the operation of the manner court and the role of the abbey are also highlighted. Includes scenes of festivities accompanying the marriage of the lord’s son.

results.title: Medieval knights
results.brief_description: Describes the development of the social class of knights in the 12th and 13th centuries and then follows one knight through his apprenticeship in arms, first as a Page, then as a Squire. The story ends with a detailed illustration of the knighting ceremony. The film was photographed in several French medieval castles.

results.title: Medieval guilds
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Discusses the growth of medieval towns and the development, functioning and gradual decay of the guilds. Describes a shoemaker’s shop, showing the activities of the master craftsman, the apprentices, and the journeymen. Filmed in the old guild towns of France, Switzerland and Belgium.

results.title: Medieval England: the peasants revolt
results.brief_description: The harsh social inequities of the Middle Ages form the background for this film. By focusing on the Peasants’ Revolt of 1381- a determined thrust for freedom by English peasants against the intolerable conditions of the manor - the film examines the grim reality of life in the late Middle Ages. Cast includes Anthony Hopkins, Edward Fox.

results.title: Medieval Dutch sculpture
results.creator_credit: Piet Van Moock and Johan Feltkamp
results.brief_description: A survey of sculpture in the Netherlands during the late Middle Ages. Although much of the sculpture of this period was destroyed in the 16th Century, sufficient remains in museums and private collections to show how the emotional quality of the early Gothic period gradually merged into the more realistic and mannered style of the later period. Statuettes are examined which express in wood and stone a series of emotions: humility, cruelty, love, pathos and humour. Narrator Gordon Jones.

results.title: Medicine in Sport (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Annabel Olivier-Wright, Ken Ashton and Tom Poole
results.brief_description: Provides an in-depth look at training routines of top soccer stars. Traces the history of soccer, and also looks at the basic skills every soccer player needs.
